John,
I pictured the ji-sukashi version, but this type in negative openwork with the elongated rectangles is often interpreted as a battle banners or as tanzaku "poem cards."  The square format writing card is called shikishi, but that is a long stretch from nihiki.

Jim

  Tom
  I found the description on an advertisement for a tsuba on Tokugawa 
  Art.  This has two measuring boxes, one either side of the seppa-dai, 
  and is described as 'nihiki design'.

  http://www.sanmei.com/shop_e/enter.html

  Regards, John L.
